cards.title: Intro
cards.body: C++ quick reference cheat sheet that provides basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: Compiling and running

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
```shell script
$ g++ hello.cpp -o hello
$ ./hello
Hello CheatSheets

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
int number = 5;       // Integer
float f = 0.95;       // Floating number
double PI = 3.14159;  // Floating number
char yes = 'Y';       // Character
std::string s = "ME"; // String (text)
bool isRight = true;  // Boolean

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Constants
const float RATE = 0.8;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
int age {25};         // Since C++11
std::cout << age;     // Print 25

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.code:
### Primitive Data Types

| Data Type | Size           | Range               |
| --------- | -------------- | ------------------- |
| `int`     | 4 bytes        | -2^31^ ^to^ 2^31^-1 |
| `float`   | 4 bytes        | _N/A_               |
| `double`  | 8 bytes        | _N/A_               |
| `char`    | 1 byte         | -128 ^to^ 127       |
| `bool`    | 1 byte         | true / false        |
| `void`    | _N/A_          | _N/A_               |
| `wchar_t` | 2 ^or^ 4 bytes | 1 wide character    |

{.show-header}

### User Input

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: int num;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
std::cout << "Type a number: ";
std::cin >> num;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: std::cout << "You entered " << num;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
int a = 5, b = 10;
std::swap(a, b);

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Outputs: a=10, b=5
std::cout << "a=" << a << ", b=" << b;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: // A single one line comment in C++

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
/* This is a multiple line comment
in C++ */

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body: #include <iostream>

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: void hello(); // Declaring

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
int i = 1;
int& ri = i; // ri is a reference to i

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
ri = 2; // i is now changed to 2
std::cout << "i=" << i;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
i = 3;   // i is now changed to 3
std::cout << "ri=" << ri;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.code:
`ri` and `i` refer to the same memory location.

### Namespaces

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.code:
Namespaces allow global identifiers under a name

## C++ Arrays

### Declaration

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Define and initialize
std::array<int, 3> = {92, 97, 98};

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Print first element
std::cout << marks[0];

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Change 2nd element to 99
marks[1] = 99;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Take input from the user
std::cin >> marks[2];

cards.body: char ref[5] = {'R', 'e', 'f'};

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.code: ### Operators {.row-span-2} #### Relational Operators | | | | -------- | ---------------------------- | | `a == b` | a is equal to b | | `a != b` | a is NOT equal to b | | `a < b` | a is less than b | | `a > b` | a is greater b | | `a <= b` | a is less than or equal to b | | `a >= b` | a is greater or equal to b | #### Assignment Operators | Example | Equivalent to | | -------- | ---------------- | | `a += b` | _Aka_ a = a + b | | `a -= b` | _Aka_ a = a - b | | `a *= b` | _Aka_ a = a \* b | | `a /= b` | _Aka_ a = a / b | | `a %= b` | _Aka_ a = a % b | #### Logical Operators | Example | Meaning | | --------------------------- | ---------------------- | | `exp1 && exp2` | Both are true _(AND)_ | | exp1 \|\| exp2 | Either is true _(OR)_ | | `!exp` | `exp` is false _(NOT)_ | #### Bitwise Operators | Operator | Description | | ------------------- | ----------------------- | | `a & b` | Binary AND | | a \| b | Binary OR | | `a ^ b` | Binary XOR | | `~ a` | Binary One's Complement | | `a << b` | Binary Shift Left | | `a >> b` | Binary Shift Right | ### Ternary Operator

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
int x = 3, y = 5, max;
max = (x > y) ? x : y;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
// Outputs: 5
std::cout << max << std::endl;

cards.code:
## C++ Classes & Objects {.cols-2}

### Defining a Class

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body: MyClass myObj;  // Create an object of MyClass

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
myObj.myNum = 15;          // Set the value of myNum to 15
myObj.myString = "Hello";  // Set the value of myString to "Hello"

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
cout << myObj.myNum << endl;         // Output 15
cout << myObj.myString << endl;      // Output "Hello"

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body: MyClass myObj;  // Create an object of MyClass

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
cout << myObj.myNum << endl;         // Output 0
cout << myObj.myString << endl;      // Output ""

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body: MyClass myObj;  // Create an object of MyClass

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: // Code here...

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: // Object is destroyed automatically when the program exits the scope

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
MyClass myObj;  // Create an object of MyClass
myObj.myMethod();  // Call the method

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
MyClass myObj;
myObj.x = 25;  // Allowed (public)
myObj.y = 50;  // Not allowed (private)
myObj.z = 75;  // Not allowed (protected)

cards.title: hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
hello.cpp
cards.body:
#include "iostream"
#include <iostream>

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#define FOO
#define FOO "hello"

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: #undef FOO

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#ifdef DEBUG
console.log('hi');
#elif defined VERBOSE
...
#else
...
#endif

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#if VERSION == 2.0
#error Unsupported
#warning Not really supported
#endif

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body: #define DEG(x) ((x) * 57.29)

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#define DST(name) name##_s name##_t
DST(object);   #=> object_s object_t;

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#define STR(name) #name
char * a = STR(object);   #=> char * a = "object";

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.body:
#define LOG(msg) console.log(__FILE__, __LINE__, msg)
#=> console.log("file.txt", 3, "hey")

cards.title: hello.cpp
cards.code:
## Miscellaneous

### Escape Sequences

| Escape Sequences | Characters            |
| ---------------- | --------------------- |
| `\b`             | Backspace             |
| `\f`             | Form feed             |
| `\n`             | Newline               |
| `\r`             | Return                |
| `\t`             | Horizontal tab        |
| `\v`             | Vertical tab          |
| `\\`             | Backslash             |
| `\'`             | Single quotation mark |
| `\"`             | Double quotation mark |
| `\?`             | Question mark         |
| `\0`             | Null Character        |
